name: Fairfield Inn Atlantic City North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a single night recently. Breakfast was chaotic.. lots of full trash cans. Out of .. everything. One lady working the buffet and the dining room. Walls were paper thin .. we could hear everything in the next room. Probably wouldn't return to this property.
reviews.title: Paper thin walls.

reviews.text: We were only there for 1 night but room was spotless and spacious, had a nice tv, microwave, and refrig. It is located only 5 mins from AC and is a straight shot. I forgot to ask if they had a shuttle but noticed hotel down the street did so I am thinking its s strong possibility that they do too. My only complaint is that the clerk that checked me in was not very friendly, he seemed like he wanted to be anywhere but there. Oh, they also had a free continental breakfast, which I missed. Free wifi, too.
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.text: Stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night. The female clerk at check in was not very friendly. After a long drive and heavy traffic, a little smile or something would have been appreciated. I asked her if any room upgrades were available (for Marriott Reward members) and she looked at me like I was crazy!!! Really? According to the website, there are rooms with 2 doubles, rooms with 1 king, and then there are suites. So don't act like upgrades aren't available for Rewards Members!!! She decided to "upgrade" us from 2 doubles to 1 king! Woo Hoo!!
reviews.title: Average in many ways
Improperly maintained and serviced
reviews.text: My biggest concern with the hotel is absolute lack of security. You can enter the lobby thru a front door or a back door. There is very little parking in the front of the hotel so most people end up parking in the back lot. The doors at the back have a un-used security system in place. You are suppose to swipe your room key and then the doors should open and allow you into the hotel. Well, the hotel does not utilize this system. We came back the hotel at 3 am on Saturday night and as we approached the back entrance, the doors opened up for us. No swipe required! We walked right in and didn't see one person....not any employee or security member, etc. I mentioned this at check out and the male employee said....."yeah, you don't need to swipe your card. You can walk in". When I mentioned that that seems a little unsafe, he said the Night Auditor had a camera/screen in their room and that the hotel "had never had a problem"!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mentioned the the hotel right next to the Fairfield Inn had a sign out front for rooms for $14.....yes $14......and with that kind of clientelle so close to the Fairfield, maybe they want to reconsider their Open Door policy. Again, the clerk said "we have never had a problem"!!
reviews.title: Very pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to our hotel very Late (12:00am) , Nevertheless it was fast & Easy when it came to checking in.
reviews.title: Nice Option for a Atlantic City Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gentlemen at the front desk was very nice & Pleasant !
reviews.title: Reasonable for the price, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made it to our room & the room had very Nice Decor (updated).
reviews.title: Nice place to stay just outside Atlantic City

reviews.text: Everything was clean & Smelled FRESH ( a plus)!
reviews.title: Quite comfortable - needs a little updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was small & our view was the highway (not much to see)
reviews.title: Affordable pleasant accomodations a few minutes from Atlantic City

reviews.text: The hotel has the feel of being converted from something less than a Marriott. Definitely seems an older property, with nothing of interest in the immediate area. However, it is super-convenient to pricier casinos hotels - so easy to get to the Marina area and complete with view of cool windmills during the short drive.
reviews.title: Best feature: location

reviews.text: Slowest elevators - ever! Doesn't help that the staff uses one as a service elevator. Also, the housekeeping staff should be advised that yelling at each other down the halls is just plain tacky.
reviews.title: Quality stay, quality property -- good service, nice rooms, etc.

reviews.text: Impressive breakfast - lots of hot item choices (waffles, eggs, oatmeal), plus the usual continental offerings.
reviews.title: Great off the boardwalk hotel

reviews.text: I had a last minute trip and this was the closest hotel to my destination that I could find.
reviews.title: What You Would Expect

reviews.text: I had a good stay here. The room was clean, well maintained, and everything was fine. The customer service was very good as well -- everyone was polite, attentive, and seemed to want to make sure our stay was good. They asked questions -- if we needed anything, asked if we wanted directions, suggestions, etc.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel at a Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get what you pay for - though the hotel has been recently renovated, you can tell that it was just a re-do of an old building and there are remnants of the "oldness" there. That being said, it doesn't cost much to stay here, so I think the price is fair.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: It's not too far from AC, however, the trip is a bit arduous at night, and the hotel is off of a little highway so you have to make sure you're approaching from the correct direction in order to turn into it.
reviews.title: Just blink from the boardwalk

reviews.text: The breakfast was OK, not particularly fresh or diverse, but for free breakfast my expectations were low. We stayed here because we had a certificate for a free Marriott night categories 1-4, though I wouldn't rate this as a category 4 hotel.
reviews.title: Good deal, nice staff, good view of the fireworks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my hotel of choice everytime I am in Atlantic City. My last visit was labor day weekend. My friends and I had a king and I must say this room was the bigest king room I have been in. I am not sure if they are all like that but wow. The breakfast is typical continental, but was great just the same. The drive to the boardwalk was about 10 mins. From Monday to Saturday, I think they have a free shuttle to Resorts. They have a pool, never used it but it looks great. I usually get a government discount when I go so I cannot speak about the price.This will continue to be my hotel of choice whenever I am in AC.
reviews.title: Your typical Fairfield

reviews.text: We stayed here for a few nights over the 4th of July. It was a central location to visit the shore towns. The staff was nice, the rooms were nice. We did have a perfect view of the AC and other fireworks from our window, which was great, considering we were travelling with an infant. My only complaint is that breakfast was super-crowded, and they did not seem to account for that. We were up early too and the lines were long, and the food service low.
reviews.title: Good hotel, quiet, friendly

aka: Fairfield Inn Atlantic City North Hotel Absecon
